title: Kees van Deemter, “Computational Models of Referring: A Study in Cognitive Science” (MIT Press, 2016)
description:
Sometimes we have to depend on philosophy to explain to us why something apparently simple is in fact extremely complicated. The way we use referring expressions – things that pick out the entities we want to talk about, such as “Mary”, or “that guy over there” – falls into this...
